001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.radio;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.util.strategy.Strategy;
005import java.util.List;
006import org.openqa.selenium.By;
007
008/**
009 * Represents a radio button or group of radio buttons in a UI automation framework.
010 * Provides methods for selecting radio buttons by text, strategy, or locator, and
011 * offers checks for enabled, visible, or selected states. It also allows retrieval
012 * of the currently selected button or a complete list of available radio buttons.
013 *
014 * <p>Implementations typically rely on Selenium-based interactions using container references
015 * ({@link SmartWebElement}) or direct locators ({@link By}), enabling consistent handling of
016 * radio inputs throughout an application.
017 *
018 * <p>This interface is intended to be used wherever a radio group or individual radio
019 * elements need to be tested or manipulated, providing a standard contract for
020 * UI automation.
021 *
022 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
023 */
024public interface Radio {
025
026   /**
027    * Selects a radio button, identified by its text, within the specified container.
028    *
029    * @param container       the container holding the radio buttons.
030    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to select.
031    */
032   void select(SmartWebElement container, String radioButtonText);
033
034   /**
035    * Selects a radio button within the specified container using a custom {@link Strategy}.
036    *
037    * @param container the container holding the radio buttons.
038    * @param strategy  the selection strategy to determine which radio button to choose.
039    * @return a string representing the selected radio button text, if available.
040    */
041   String select(SmartWebElement container, Strategy strategy);
042
043   /**
044    * Selects a radio button, identified by its text, without referencing a container.
045    *
046    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to select.
047    */
048   void select(String radioButtonText);
049
050   /**
051    * Selects a radio button identified by a {@link By} locator.
052    *
053    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator identifying the radio button to select.
054    */
055   void select(By radioButtonLocator);
056
057   /**
058    * Checks if the specified radio button is enabled within the given container.
059    *
060    * @param container       the container holding the radio button.
061    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
062    * @return true if the radio button is enabled, otherwise false.
063    */
064   boolean isEnabled(SmartWebElement container, String radioButtonText);
065
066   /**
067    * Checks if the specified radio button, identified by text, is enabled without referencing a container.
068    *
069    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
070    * @return true if the radio button is enabled, otherwise false.
071    */
072   boolean isEnabled(String radioButtonText);
073
074   /**
075    * Checks if the radio button identified by a locator is enabled.
076    *
077    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator identifying the radio button to check.
078    * @return true if the radio button is enabled, otherwise false.
079    */
080   boolean isEnabled(By radioButtonLocator);
081
082   /**
083    * Checks if the specified radio button is selected within the given container.
084    *
085    * @param container       the container holding the radio button.
086    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
087    * @return true if the radio button is selected, otherwise false.
088    */
089   boolean isSelected(SmartWebElement container, String radioButtonText);
090
091   /**
092    * Checks if the specified radio button, identified by text, is selected without referencing a container.
093    *
094    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
095    * @return true if the radio button is selected, otherwise false.
096    */
097   boolean isSelected(String radioButtonText);
098
099   /**
100    * Checks if the radio button identified by a locator is selected.
101    *
102    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator identifying the radio button to check.
103    * @return true if the radio button is selected, otherwise false.
104    */
105   boolean isSelected(By radioButtonLocator);
106
107   /**
108    * Checks if the specified radio button is visible within the given container.
109    *
110    * @param container       the container holding the radio button.
111    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
112    * @return true if the radio button is visible, otherwise false.
113    */
114   boolean isVisible(SmartWebElement container, String radioButtonText);
115
116   /**
117    * Checks if the specified radio button, identified by text, is visible without referencing a container.
118    *
119    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
120    * @return true if the radio button is visible, otherwise false.
121    */
122   boolean isVisible(String radioButtonText);
123
124   /**
125    * Checks if the radio button identified by a locator is visible.
126    *
127    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator identifying the radio button to check.
128    * @return true if the radio button is visible, otherwise false.
129    */
130   boolean isVisible(By radioButtonLocator);
131
132   /**
133    * Retrieves the text of the currently selected radio button within the given container.
134    *
135    * @param container the container holding the radio buttons.
136    * @return the text of the selected radio button, or an empty string if none is selected.
137    */
138   String getSelected(SmartWebElement container);
139
140   /**
141    * Retrieves the text of the currently selected radio button within the container located by the given locator.
142    *
143    * @param containerLocator the locator identifying the container.
144    * @return the text of the selected radio button, or an empty string if none is selected.
145    */
146   String getSelected(By containerLocator);
147
148   /**
149    * Retrieves a list of all radio button texts within the given container.
150    *
151    * @param container the container holding the radio buttons.
152    * @return a list of all available radio button texts.
153    */
154   List<String> getAll(SmartWebElement container);
155
156   /**
157    * Retrieves a list of all radio button texts within the container located by the given locator.
158    *
159    * @param containerLocator the locator identifying the container.
160    * @return a list of all available radio button texts.
161    */
162   List<String> getAll(By containerLocator);
163
164}
